title.value: Using incorpoRATE to examine clinician willingness to engage in shared decision making: A study of Family Medicine residents
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the paper and represents the primary focus of the research.
title.quote: Using incorpoRATE to examine clinician willingness to engage in shared decision making: A study of Family Medicine residents

extractions.description: The paper investigates the willingness of Family Medicine residents to engage in shared decision making (SDM) before and after an educational intervention. The study aims to evaluate whether educational interventions can influence the readiness of clinicians to adopt SDM practices in preventive healthcare settings.

type.justification: The paper describes an empirical study involving Family Medicine residents assessed through a measure before and after an educational intervention.
type.quote: We evaluated the willingness of Family Medicine residents to engage in SDM, before and after an educational intervention.

name.justification: The research focuses on training Family Medicine residents and evaluating their willingness to embrace shared decision making, which falls under medical education.
name.quote: We evaluated the willingness of Family Medicine residents to engage in SDM, before and after an educational intervention.

name.justification: The study specifically investigates Shared Decision Making in Family Medicine, aiming to understand and measure willingness to engage in this practice.
name.quote: Using incorpoRATE to examine clinician willingness to engage in shared decision making

name.justification: The incorpoRATE measure is repeatedly mentioned as the tool used to assess the willingness of FM residents to engage in shared decision making.

referenced_paper_title.value: The development of incorpoRATE: A measure of physiciansâ€™ willingness to incorporate shared decision making into practice
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper refers to a prior publication for detailed information on incorpoRATE, indicating that it is a measure developed and documented in a different study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For detailed information, we refer the reader to a prior publication (full measure available on request to Dr. Elwyn) [10].
